description: Number of i such that d(i)>=d(i-1), where Sum{d(i)*2^i: i=0,1,...,m} is base 2 representation of n.
links: R. Stephan, Table of generating functions
example: The base-2 representation of n=4 is 100 with d(0)=0, d(1)=0, d(2)=1. There are two rise-or-equal, one from d(0) to d(1) and one from d(1) to d(2), so a(4)=2. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 16 2015
maple: A033265 := proc(n)    a := 0 ;    dgs := convert(n,base,2);    for i from 2 to nops(dgs) do        if op(i,dgs)>=op(i-1,dgs) then            a := a+1 ;        end if;    end do:    a ;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 16 2015
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: Sign in Name corrected. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 16 2015
